abstract.p: Hap wins Bernard Baruch Handicap at Saratoga Race Track (S)

block.p: Bill Mott and Jerry Bailey again demonstrated their dominance of turf racing as the lightly raced Hap roared home a winner in a crowded 13-horse field in the Grade II Bernard Baruch Handicap yesterday at Saratoga Race Course in Saratoga Springs, N.Y.

The Mott-trained son of Theatrical nailed down his first stakes victory and collected $90,000 of the $150,000 purse for his owner, Madeleine Paulson, chiefly because Bailey executed quick thinking and agile hands heading into the first turn of the mile-and-an-eighth race. Breaking from the No. 9 post, Bailey was fanned eight wide before gunning the colt inside.

Bill Mott and Jerry Bailey again demonstrated their dominance of turf racing as the lightly raced Hap roared home a winner in a crowded 13-horse field in the Grade II Bernard Baruch Handicap yesterday at Saratoga Race Course in Saratoga Springs, N.Y.

The Mott-trained son of Theatrical nailed down his first stakes victory and collected $90,000 of the $150,000 purse for his owner, Madeleine Paulson, chiefly because Bailey executed quick thinking and agile hands heading into the first turn of the mile-and-an-eighth race. Breaking from the No. 9 post, Bailey was fanned eight wide before gunning the colt inside.
''It was either force the issue or take back,'' Bailey said. ''So, I pulled the trigger and let him go. We were third down the backstretch.''
Bailey Hap chased an extremely quick pace by Gone Fishin before taking the lead in the stretch and holding off late runs from Inexplicable and Draw Shot. Hap paid $9.20 for a $2 bet to win.
